title: Which Star Trek inventions are now common place in our society? - Quora
tags: Star Trek: The Next Generation (TV series)

response.answer_text: When I used to watch STOS as a 10 year old, I remember my father commenting on the series. He laughed when he saw Kirk using his communicator, saying how ridiculous that was. Fast forward a few decades, and this is mainstream. Another innovation, was the PADD, which the STNG crew used to monitor systems read, and record events, even using it with a digital pen to write in DS9. Fast forward a few decades again after the series showed that tech, and Apple launched its own iPad, possibly inspired by Star Trek name for the device.
